alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 4:07PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Breathitt and east central Lee Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 407 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Canyon Falls, or 8 miles east of Beattyville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... War Creek, Gentry and Yeadon around 420 PM EDT. Lawson, Frozen Creek and Elkatawa around 425 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Jackson, Vancleve, Wilhurst, Fivemile, Sewell, Keck and Simpson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
